00032 // Implementation for the CE Clause class.
00033 
00034 #ifdef __GNUG__
00035 #pragma implementation
00036 #endif
00037 
00038 #include "config_dap.h"

00040 #include <assert.h>

00042 #include "expr.h"
00043 #include "DDS.h"
00044 #include "Clause.h"

00046 using std::cerr;
00047 using std::endl;
00048 
00049 Clause::Clause(const int oper, rvalue *a1, rvalue_list *rv)
00050     : _op(oper), _b_func(0), _bt_func(0), _arg1(a1), _args(rv) 
00051 {
00052     assert(OK());
00053 }
00054 
00055 Clause::Clause(bool_func func, rvalue_list *rv)
00056     : _op(0), _b_func(func), _bt_func(0), _arg1(0), _args(rv)
00057 {
00058     assert(OK());
00059 
00060     if (_args)          // account for null arg list
00061     _argc = _args->size();
00062     else
00063     _argc = 0;
00064 }
00065 
00066 Clause::Clause(btp_func func, rvalue_list *rv)
00067     : _op(0), _b_func(0), _bt_func(func), _arg1(0), _args(rv)
00068 {
00069     assert(OK());
00070 
00071     if (_args)
00072     _argc = _args->size();
00073     else
00074     _argc = 0;
00075 }
00076 
00077 Clause::Clause() : _op(0), _b_func(0), _bt_func(0), _arg1(0), _args(0)
00078 {
00079 }
00080 
00081 static inline void
00082 delete_rvalue(rvalue *rv)
00083 {
00084     delete rv;
00085 }
00086 
00087 Clause::~Clause() 
00088 {
00089     if (_arg1) {
00090     delete _arg1;
00091     _arg1 = 0;
00092     }
00093     
00094     if (_args) {
00095     // _args is a pointer to a vector<rvalue*> and we must must delete
00096     // each rvalue pointer here explicitly. 02/03/04 jhrg
00097     for_each(_args->begin(), _args->end(), delete_rvalue);
00098     delete _args;
00099     _args = 0;
00100     }
00101 }
00102 
00104 bool
00105 Clause::OK()
00106 {
00107     // Each clause object can contain one of: a relational clause, a boolean
00108     // function clause or a BaseType pointer function clause. It must have a
00109     // valid argument list.
00110     //
00111     // But, a valid arg list might contain zero arguments! 10/16/98 jhrg
00112     bool relational = (_op && !_b_func && !_bt_func);
00113     bool boolean = (!_op && _b_func && !_bt_func);
00114     bool basetype = (!_op && !_b_func && _bt_func);
00115 
00116     if (relational)
00117     return _arg1 && _args;
00118     else if (boolean || basetype)
00119     return true;        // Until we check arguments...10/16/98 jhrg
00120     else 
00121     return false;
00122 }
00123 
00125 bool 
00126 Clause::boolean_clause()
00127 {
00128     assert(OK());
00129 
00130     return _op || _b_func;
00131 }
00132 
00134 bool
00135 Clause::value_clause()
00136 {
00137     assert(OK());
00138 
00139     return (_bt_func != 0);
00140 }
00141 
00143 bool 
00144 Clause::value(const string &dataset, DDS &dds) 
00145 {
00146     assert(OK());
00147     assert(_op || _b_func);
00148 
00149     if (_op) {          // Is it a relational clause?
00150     // rvalue::bvalue(...) returns the rvalue encapsulated in a
00151     // BaseType *.
00152     BaseType *btp = _arg1->bvalue(dataset, dds);
00153     // The list of rvalues is an implicit logical OR, so assume
00154     // FALSE and return TRUE for the first TRUE subclause.
00155     bool result = false;
00156     for (rvalue_list_iter i = _args->begin();
00157          i != _args->end() && !result;
00158          i++)
00159     {
00160         result = result || btp->ops((*i)->bvalue(dataset, dds),
00161                     _op, dataset);
00162     }
00163 
00164     return result;
00165     }
00166     else if (_b_func) {     // ...A bool function?
00167     BaseType **argv = build_btp_args(_args, dds);
00168 
00169     bool result = (*_b_func)(_argc, argv, dds);
00170     delete[] argv;      // Cache me!
00171     argv = 0;
00172 
00173     return result;
00174     }
00175     else {
00176     cerr << "Internal error: " << endl
00177          << "The constraint expression parser built an invalid clause."
00178          << endl
00179          << "Please report this error." << endl;
00180     return false;
00181     }
00182 }
00183 
00185 bool 
00186 Clause::value(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, BaseType **value) 
00187 {
00188     assert(OK());
00189     assert(_bt_func);
00190 
00191     if (_bt_func) {
00192     BaseType **argv = build_btp_args(_args, dds);
00193 
00194     *value = (*_bt_func)(_argc, argv, dds);
00195     delete[] argv;      // Cache me!
00196     argv = 0;
00197 
00198     if (*value) {
00199         (*value)->set_read_p(true);
00200         (*value)->set_send_p(true);
00201         return true;
00202     }
00203     else {
00204         return false;
00205     }
00206     }
00207     else {
00208     cerr << "Internal error:" << endl
00209         << "The constraint expression parser built an invalid clause."
00210         << endl
00211         << "Please report this error." << endl;
00212     return false;
00213     }
00214 }

00267 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00268 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00269 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00270 // just good form when using delete.

00272 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
